issue.title: Drive: Rclone doesn't sync Google Docs

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Attached is a screen capture of my G Drive showing all the folders and some of the files.

![screenshot-20150424-174336](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1153703/7314813/56948522-eaab-11e4-9e8d-78fd41a42f65.png)

Below is what:

rclone lsd GD: | sort -k 5

shows:

```
      -1 2014-06-28 09:18:09        -1 CNASALERC
      -1 2013-04-28 17:12:33        -1 Drive Sync Images
      -1 2013-03-20 08:38:03        -1 HandWrittenNotes
      -1 2014-07-03 08:23:16        -1 Health
      -1 2015-04-09 14:01:41        -1 Kathalina
      -1 2015-03-03 00:35:17        -1 LESTp
      -1 2014-08-20 17:11:08        -1 LEV
      -1 2013-03-27 07:53:36        -1 My Tracks
      -1 2014-07-13 07:36:47        -1 PhD_UNSW
      -1 2015-02-21 02:00:25        -1 SMSs
      -1 2014-06-05 08:02:51        -1 Writing
      -1 2015-04-22 11:31:58        -1 video
```

ie ALL the folders.  Below is what:

rclone copy GD:/ ./

gives:

drwxrws---   3 phil phil      4096 Apr 24 14:05 Drive Sync Images
drwxrws---   2 phil phil      4096 Apr 24 14:10 HandWrittenNotes
drwxrws---   2 phil phil      4096 Apr 24 14:02 Kathalina
drwxrws---   2 phil phil      4096 Apr 24 14:05 LEV
drwxrws---   2 phil phil      4096 Apr 24 14:06 My Tracks
drwxrws---   2 phil phil      4096 Apr 24 14:05 PhD_UNSW
drwxrws---   2 phil phil      4096 Apr 24 14:05 SMSs
drwxrws---   6 phil phil      4096 Apr 24 14:06 Writing
-rw-rw-r--   1 phil phil    151613 Feb 15  2014 AguadoSec02No10_gnote2_3_24pt.pdf
-rw-rw-r--   1 phil phil     44509 Feb 15  2014 JulioSalvadorSagreras_1_p07.pdf
-rw-rw-r--   1 phil phil    123555 Feb 12  2014 Julio_Salvador_Sagreras_Las_Primeras_Lecciones_de_guitarra.xml
-rw-rw-r--   1 phil phil       139 Feb 13  2014 Julio_Salvador_Sagreras_Las_Primeras_Lecciones_de_guitarra_p10_w7.mid
-rw-rw-r--   1 phil phil       652 Feb 12  2014 Julio_Salvador_Sagreras_Las_Primeras_Lecciones_de_guitarra_p2.mid
-rw-rw-r--   1 phil phil   2319437 Feb 20  2012 Report20209_1.png
-rw-rw-r--   1 phil phil   1688514 Feb 20  2012 Report20209_2.png
-rw-rw-r--   1 phil phil       933 Mar  7 14:18 SajeCrt.txt
-rw-rw-r--   1 phil phil     36164 Apr 24 17:45 Screenshot-042415-17:43:36.png
-rw-rw-r--   1 phil phil       602 Feb 16  2014 ssh-dss.txt
-rw-rw-r--   1 phil phil       240 Feb  3 15:19 t.csv

ie missing folders and files.

So between the lsd and the copy commands, something goes wrong . . ideas?

Thanks,

Phil.

issue.title: Gogle Docs not showing in Google Drive

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body: rclone is only seeing the regular files I store in Google Drive. I'm not able to see or sync any of the native google docs, sheets, etc,

body: Here is a beta to try the fix for this: http://pub.rclone.org/v1.27-1-g5dd387f%CE%B2/

Solves my issue described here 
[https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/49#issuecomment-180808036](url)
Seems to work on root directory without --drive-full-list flag.

Hi Nick

I've started seeing these pacer messages since using the new beta, I don't
remember seeing them before.. is this normal?

Regards

David

2016/02/12 22:30:01 drive: Saving new token in config file
2016/02/12 22:30:02 S3 bucket drive-backup: Modify window is 1ms
2016/02/12 22:30:02 S3 bucket drive-backup: Building file list
2016/02/12 22:30:03 pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 20ms
2016/02/12 22:30:03 pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 40ms
2016/02/12 22:30:03 pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 80ms
2016/02/12 22:30:03 pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 160ms
2016/02/12 22:30:03 pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 320ms
2016/02/12 22:30:03 pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 640ms
2016/02/12 22:30:03 pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 1.28s
2016/02/12 22:30:04 pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 2s
2016/02/12 22:30:07 Google drive root '': Finished reading

On 12 February 2016 at 21:58, Rob Challen notifications@github.com wrote:

> Solves my issue described here
> https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/49#issuecomment-180808036
> http://url
> Seems to work on root directory without --drive-full-list flag.
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/336#issuecomment-183503259.

## 

---

David White
07525 807295

I've merged this to master - you can find the fix in this beta

http://pub.rclone.org/v1.27-11-g1cd0d9a%CE%B2/

It will be in the next release
@dolabriform the pacer messages are normal - Drive does that when it is getting congested I think.

issue.title: v1.27 Serious bug - rclone recursive algorithm missing some files/directories on Google drive source

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
I have a Drive on Google Apps for Education - and sync is not catching all the files.

Investigating further, I noticed:
# rclone@phoenix:/vol/kdldata/GoogleDriveBackup$ /usr/local/bin/rclone --stats=0 ls 'twatts_kdl:/Shared Drive/' | grep 'Non Pay'

   180534 KDL Group Share/KDL Admin/Finances/2015-2016/KDL Non Pay Finances 2015-2016.xlsx

Transferred:            0 Bytes (   0.00 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            0
# Elapsed time:       29.5s

which is correct:

BUT
# rclone@phoenix:/vol/kdldata/GoogleDriveBackup$ /usr/local/bin/rclone --stats=0 ls 'twatts_kdl:/' | grep 'Non Pay'

Transferred:            0 Bytes (   0.00 kByte/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            0
# Elapsed time:       59.8s

Starting a recursive listing from one level higher in the drive tree is causing certain files AND folders lower down to disappear from the source listing. The missing files/folders are consistent with what is not on the local target after a sync operation.

This suggests a problem with the recursion algorithm.

NB - files are owned by various people but I have access to all.

To see how many missing files there are:
# /usr/local/bin/rclone --stats=0 ls 'twatts_kdl:/Shared Drive/' | wc -l
#220
# /usr/local/bin/rclone --stats=0 ls 'twatts_kdl:/' | grep 'Shared Drive' | wc -l
#157

So it is missing 63 files!

Investigating further, I produced a list of the missing files.

Every single missing file is a Google Doc. Many of them were created or imported by me and reside in a tree where I created every node, so that seems to rule out it getting confused over permissions.

If I select my whole Google Drive in Chrome, do a "Download", unpack the zipfile and look in the "Shared Drive" directory and run "find -type f | wc -l" I get 220 files, the expected number, which is a further verification that I have permissions. My account is also the GA4Education admin account.

Happy to help debug this -

Cheers, Tim Watts
